question.title: What is the primary condition that must be met before inserting a central venous line?
question.description: Select the correct condition from the options below.

option_a.title: The patient must be on a ventilator
option_a.description: A patient on mechanical ventilation may require a central venous line for medication administration or monitoring.

option_b.title: The patient must have a history of cardiac disease
option_b.description: Central venous lines are often used in patients with cardiac disease, but this is not a primary condition for insertion.

option_c.title: The patient must be experiencing severe sepsis
option_c.description: While central venous lines may be used in septic patients, this is not a primary condition for insertion.

option_d.title: The patient must be undergoing chemotherapy
option_d.description: Chemotherapy patients may require central venous lines for medication administration, but this is not a primary condition for insertion.
